headline.main: U.S. Lawyers Ready to Help Son of Sheik Linked to Plot

lead_paragraph: Three lawyers who represented Sheik Omar Abdel Rahman, the blind Egyptian cleric convicted in 1995 in a terrorist plot to blow up New York City landmarks, said yesterday that they were ready to represent his son Ahmed, who is believed to have been captured in Afghanistan. Although American officials have not announced any arrest of Ahmed Abdel Rahman, 28, the lawyers said they had spoken with his family members in Egypt, who had apparently identified photographs of the son shown to them by reporters and others.
abstract: Lawyers who represented Sheik Omar Abdel Rahman, blind Egyptian cleric convicted in 1995 terrorist plot to blow up New York City landmarks, say they are ready to represent his son Ahmed, who is believed to have been captured by Northern Alliance forces in Afghanistan; team includes Ramsey Clark, Lynne F Stewart and Abdeen M Jabara (M)
